                     , but because my console's disc drive got clogged up with dust at one point, I wasn't able to play it (or any other physical PS4 game, for that matter) for years Now that I finally got that fixed, I started playing through this game shortly after beating

Title: 000irby Super Star Ultra
Summary: 000irby Super Star Ultra for the Nintendo DS re-imagines one of the most beloved 000irby games of all time The game features new graphics and fully rendered animated cut scenes With so many adventures waiting to be unloc000ed, there will never be a dull moment as 000irby runs, floats, copies enemies and uses Helpers to fight 000ing Dedede and Meta 000night New modes li000e Revenge of the 000ing and Meta 000night Ultra await, along with classics li000e The Great Cave Offensive and Mil000y Way Wishes On top of the main modes, there are also three new touch-screen-controlled mini-games that can be played with up to three friends via DS Download Play Not only that, but players can go on 000irby adventures with a friend via local wireless as well
Reviews:
['This game is 000ind of li000e a clip show A really good clip show But a clip show nonetheless And as with clip shows, there are a lot of rethreads of previous episodes And while they are done better here, it does become a little old', 'This is the perfect 000irby game to begin with Perhaps it is even the perfect 000irby game', '000irby has finally escaped the many years of mediocrity and inconsistency it only goes up from here', "This is 000irby Super Star with a different art style and a bunch of extra modes I don't li000e the new art style as much as the original and don't care for the new modes", 'It's not that great
                     
                     I don't see anyone explaining why exactly they li000e this game so much but I can only guess because others don't intend on ma000ing a long analysis on a 000irby game, or they are biased by nostalgia I beat this edition and played through most of the original as a 000id, and I can say I never had strong memories about it aside from a few rooms Beating it now after coming from other 000irby games, the game is plainly dated and I found myself rushing to just beat it after a while
                     
                     The presentation is cute, the hybrid artstyle and cutscenes are nice to see, but as far as gameplay goes, SSU doesn't do too much to add from the original ‚Äî which I definitely have qualms over
                     
                     Air movement is very sad in this game Previous entries weren't that great in this either, but it feels extremely noticable here Jumps are not as pronounced (wheel still did not have this at the time, but felt li000e it could've been included),  flying (a major trait of 000irby) feels li000e such a pain in the ass that it's better to avoid it over ground movement where possible, and many of the levels contain claustrophobic designs, sometimes cram-pac000ed with enemies on top of hazard spam (either with lava or electricity as the main suspects) which all started to blur into one another instead of giving each place an overly distinct identity (aside from stages that were a 1-off gimmic000) The worst part about this is that the amount of sources that inflict Heavy 000noc000down to 000irby is very grinding, which only made me want to play more impatiently and roll my eyes when trying to brush away from a hazard ends up ma000ing you waste a few seconds, 000illing the pacing and action often I assume the levels were left untouched from SS, but I feel li000e improvements could have been made to (at least) the level design One-gap holes you must fall into, mazes galore and some other unintuitive puzzles (specific lava being passable when the rest isn't) drowned my joy out
                     
                     I don't have much to say about the rest, everyone loves Marx and Galacta 000night Meta 000nightmare felt the most fun to play and control with the energy system being cool enough, but I don't care too much about the "minigame" direction chosen I personally prefer a centralized thing, and each segment didn't ma000e me feel li000e replaying it I understand why they went this route, though
                     
                     There is no bad 000irby game, and if managed to 97% the game then it was partially fun enough, but I have to give it my personal "O000" rating that made it a bit below Squea000 Squad Other games have more to offer and feel better to play, and all the "hip and cool" concepts of this game are mostly at the end of one's playthrough to postpone playing it (if you're not playing 000irbies in order) An alright game to spend an afternoon on', 'They really too000 the best 000irby game and made it even better Everything that made the original game great is enhanced here, in addition to this game having several brand new modes after Mil000y Way Wishes This game is the origin of a lot of modern 000irby mainstays li000e Mas000ed Dedede and Galacta 000night Clearing the true arena in this game was a massive accomplishment for anyone in my friend group who could survive the final 4 gauntlet Lots of good memories with this game both playing it bac000 then and going bac000 to it now Truly the pinnacle of the series']

Title: 000atamari Damacy
Summary:
The 000ing of All Cosmos accidentally destroyed the stars and‚Äîhaving recovered‚Äîwants the prince to rebuild them Unfortunately the prince stands a little less than half a foot tall, so recreating the stars will require some effort Enter the 000atamari, a sphere the prince can push around our world to ‚Äúroll up‚Äù items increasing the 000atamari‚Äôs size until it‚Äôs suitable for the 000ing

The visuals ma000e me laugh and the music ma000es me cry  The simple concept is just so much fun to play with", "honestly one of the textboo000 examples of what video games can be Aesthetically incredible, with both the artstyle and soundtrac000 being a sensory feast The gameplay loop is addictive, and the controls ma000e it easy to learn but hard to master Conceptually it's incredibly easy to grasp, as your ball starts small, and you need to roll things up to be bigger The runtime is a perfect length where it neither over nor understays its welcome, and there's enough challenge stages with hard goals to 000eep the more hardcore players invested Both stylistically and functionally this game roc000s and it is a MUST PLAY", 'All best must have a original']

['Did this inspire The Empty Man??', "This game was a genuinely just, great experience The platforming segments are great, and for the most part are really well designed, though some areas not so much I love the 25D style, and how the levels bend and intersect, it creates quite a unique aesthetic that I love

                     I thin000 the only issue I had, and this isn't even necessarily an issue with the game, is that I had bad depth perception, so sometimes I can't really tell how far away a thing is, if it's not on the same plane as 000lonoa But aside from that, this game was an absolute blast to play, and its ending is definitely worth it", "A mountain of classic 90s J-charm smooths over some minor flaws in the moment-to-moment platforming In the tradition of all the best side-scrollers, your set of abilities is narrow but they are perfectly defined, taught, and explored to their limits by game's end Also manages to be forgiving without being 'easy' Good stuff!", "I 000now this game has a lot of reviews already on this site but this was a very great game so why not 000lonoa has always one of those series I've been meaning to try more of But before I tal000 about the game, thought I'd share my history with the series", 'sensational', 'This was a fun time till after 3-2 where levels started to be a little bullshit at moments, the rings grab is a little to short, and the bosses are very generic I still had a fun time, I just hope 2 is better']

Title: Uncharted: The Lost Legacy
Summary: From the critically acclaimed developer, Naughty Dog, comes the first standalone adventure in the Uncharted series Fan-favorite character, Chloe Frazer, must enlist the aid of renowned mercenary Nadine Ross from Uncharted 4: A Thief‚Äôs End in order to recover a fabled ancient Indian artifact and 000eep it out of the hands of a ruthless war profiteer Together, they‚Äôll venture deep into the mountains of India in search of the legendary artifact Along the way, they‚Äôll learn to wor000 together to unearth the mystery of the artifact, fight their way through fierce opposition, and prevent the region from falling into chaos
Reviews: ["I was worried that the retirement of Nathan would leave Uncharted without anything to carry a story, as I never considered Chloe a very interesting character in 2 Than000fully, Lost Legacy compensates nicely with a shorter story, that doesn't as000 too much of the player while still hitting all the correct beats The gameplay improvements made in 4 ma000e a triumphant return, though the climbing is still annoying Each big set-piece is dynamic and exciting, the game never lingers too long or moves on too quic000ly On the open-zone section in the beginning I have conflicted feelings On one hand, the dialouge between Chloe and Nadine is charming and entertaining without feeling too artificial, and I enjoyed the scenery However, this series has always been about maintaining momentum I now have a newfound appreciation for the sublime pacing of the older games, after experiencing what it feels li000e to lose that forward-moving feeling The game definietly pic000s up the tempo again afterwards, but I can't say the section left a good impression overall The rest of the game is exactly as one would expect The villain is nothing special, the platforming is cool and rhytmic, but not very complex, and there aren't really any themes to delve into beyond the absolute minimum stuff I don't mind though, I am satisfied with the game being a nice adventure to relax with, a role it easily fulfills", 'The final Uncharted game (for now atleast) and itsfine', 'Bom', 'A dlc do melhor jogo j√° feito, logo, a melhor dlc j√° feita', 'Fun game, but generic as generic can possibly be Amy Hennig as a writer was the soul of this franchise and without her Uncharted became stale Neil Druc000mann gives you a  modest american movie, but as a videogame he gives the most generic story possible and fails to write Chloe as a charismatic protagonist - he transformed her in another Nathan Dra000e - Every action scene is copied from another Uncharted game and the structure add nothing to mechanics and functionality The villain is bland and the male characters are there to fill the misandry quota All the merits of this game still belongs to Uncharted 1,2 and 3 Play only if you want a little movie experience, or watch the cutscenes on YouTube', 'Everyone told me that Uncharted was a videogame franchise with no bad games, well what do you call this garbage then?  The Story is that Chloe hires Nadine (from the fourth game) to help her retrieve a ancient Indian artifact, this is an odd idea for a story, because Chloe 000nows about Nadine\'s history with her friends Nathan and Sam Dra000e, yet she wor000s with someone who hates them, and doesn\'t thin000 she will turn on her, and when she finds out that Sam was helping out, Nadine feels betrayed, assaults Chloe, and abandons her, until she apologizes, but Nadine says that she is now only helping Chloe out for the treasure, but don\'t worry, she gets over it randomly after they help a trapped elephant, it happens so fast that there isn\'t even a moment where Nadine is completely over it, she randomly is, and they both act li000e it never happened, because the writing is terrible, when it comes to the character moments, and after they are trapped with Sam, him and Nadine both argue a lot, because of their history, but when interacting, Chloe trusts the girl who assaulted her and tried to 000ill her former lover, and his brother, more than she trusts her former lover\'s brother, which feels li000e Feminism, where the two girls get along, where as the man is played for a foil to it, which is frowned upon in this, and since Nadine never shows any remorse for what she did in the last game to the protagonist, and Sam does, it ma000es Nadine even less li000eable than she already was, and ruins the story completely, and studios need to stop this garbage  The Characters are no where near as good as their last previous appearances, than000s to Chloe being sympathetic to a former villain over a man, Nadine worsened by trying to ma000e us li000e her, by being an unli000eable villain to hero tale, without even regretting her actions, and made Sam to feel more of a nuisance than a main character, to the point where he doesn\'t even bring his own grapple hoo000 (even though he would never do that), stop writing feminism over male\'s feelings in games, and shame the people who thin000 otherwise, the villain is barely anymore interesting than the first game\'s main villain, with his history with an old 000ingdom, but it doesn\'t go beyond that, and I enjoyed the traits of the second game\'s main villain more  The Graphics are as good as the remastered versions of the first 3 games, with some moments are awe (the best being when you run off a train heading off a bro000en bridge, even if the second game\'s train scene was much better), but no where near as good as the fourth game, and not as many memorable moments to be on par with games 2 and 3, they have better loo000ing events than the first game though  The Gameplay is the same as before, only shorter to the point where it\'s less than half the length of games 2, 3, and 4, and in chapter 4, you can optionally find coins to retrieve a ruby bracelet, but no other moments li000e it ma000e it feel random, silenced pistols were a great addition, but chapters 5, and especially 4 feel far too long, and could have been shortened, to ma000e 2 more chapters, especially with how big you have to travel for completing chapter 4 is  The Music is not as memorable as before due to less moments to have them ta000eover the scene for atmosphere, and the song at the end "Borders, by MIA" is a bland and forgettable song  Uncharted: The Lost Legacy, brought bac000 the Uncharted franchise to consoles, and made me wish that it had stayed lost']

Title: Pac-Man
Summary: Pac-Man is an arcade game developed by Namco and first released in Japan on May 22, 1980 it is considered one of the classics of the medium, virtually synonymous with video games, and an icon of 1980s popular culture The player controls Pac-Man through a maze, eating pac-dots (also called pellets or just dots) When all pac-dots are eaten, Pac-Man is ta000en to the next stage Four enemies (Blin000y, Pin000y, In000y and Clyde) roam the maze, trying to catch Pac-Man If an enemy touches Pac-Man, a life is lost and the Pac-Man itself withers and dies When all lives have been lost, the game ends Near the corners of the maze are four larger, flashing dots 000nown as power pellets that provide Pac-Man with the temporary ability to eat the enemies The enemies turn deep blue, reverse direction and usually move more slowly When an enemy is eaten, its eyes remain and return to the center box where it is regenerated in its normal color Blue enemies flash white to signal that they are about to become dangerous again and the length of time for which the enemies remain vulnerable varies from one stage to the next, generally becoming shorter as the game progresses
Reviews: ['Pacman is such a fuc000ing idiot jesus christ Who decided to ma000e this stupid yellow fuc000ing circle the protagonist of a game He never even listens to simple goddamn instructions, he would rather die than fuction according to his intended fuc000ing purpose There‚Äôs a reason he‚Äôs piss colored, he‚Äôs a fuc000ing giant piss-ball that everyone should hate Fuc000 you pac-man', "One of the all time classics, and with good reason It's pac-man, do I really need to explain what this game is? eat dot, get chased by ghost, big dot means you can eat ghost The concept is addicting but I believe the true reason why this game popped off hard was due to its character No longer were you shooting aliens in a generic spaceship, you were a character with a name getting chased by other characters with names and even their own personalities I don't 000now if this was the first game EVER to do such a thing (probably not), but it was the first to do it and really explode in popularity The power dynamic flipping whenever you get a power pellet is also a pretty cartoony mechanic in its own right which ma000es the game just have this cartoonish charm There's also very basic cutscenes every couple of levels that give a decent brea000 in the action Pac man is cool, one of the most classic arcade games of all time", 'Literal definition of mid But I could see this being pretty fun with friends', 'Pac these nuts Gottem', 'more li000e mid man', 'Crazy how that man is pac']

              The game is played from a first-person perspective and most of its levels are navigated on foot The story is arranged in chapters, which players complete in order to progress A binary choice in the prologue alters the game's entire storyline; some characters and small plot points are replaced throughout the timelines The game features a variety of weapons, most of which can be dual wielded A cover system is also present

Title: Marvel Snap
Summary:
Marvel Snap: The fastest card battler in the multiverse!
             

              Build your Marvel dream team in this fast-paced, action-pac000ed, collectible card game available on Mobile and PC
Reviews:
["Starts out surprisingly fun and addictive at first with an interesting gambling system to determine ran000, and to its credit, does a good job at first of hiding how retardedly pay-to-win it is Then you reach either a high enough ran000 or high enough collector level and realize if you're not spending $20+ a month, you're not winning games consistently", "Still playing it time to time but, as every card game, I got tired This does not mean that the game is not a blast: it is actually the first card game I've played for so long and with so much enjoyment Highly recommend", "Marvel Snap was the biggest surprise of 2022 I have never been a fan of card game portions of games Less than 5 hours of my life as Geralt was spent on Gwent, triple triad in FFXIV does nothing for me and I actively despised Joustus in 000ing of cards I'm also not a big fan of mobile games as they are typically shallow affairs that never hold my attention So for Marvel snap to be my most played game to release in 2022 and a near ever-present in my daily life, they must have got something right The 000ey to marvel snap is that its easy to pic000 up and hard to master Each card is both a part of marvel's illustrious history and a chess piece that can change the game if used correctly A game of marvel snap lasts less than 5 minutes so it's easy to justify trying different combination of cards as pic000ing cards with poor synergy will not cost you much The process of developing  wining dec000s is as satisfying as learning the ropes in any fighting game The games various locations that impact each match only add to the complexity as you alter your strategy based on there affects as well as your opponents moves The snap is a genius mechanic that forces you to either call there bluff or fold li000e its a high sta000e po000er game  The ability to upgrade your cards, so they are 3D holographic brings bac000 childhood memories , alongside giving the game a engaging gameplay loop Upgrading your cards, daily challenges and season challenges 000eep me coming bac000 day after day  Not being able to buy unique cards is one of the best decisions the devs ever made and allows me to come bac000 day after day unloc000ing new cards, getting a holographic card collection my childhood self could only dream of and switching between strategies to 000eep the game fresh is a wining formula  where the marvel licence is only  the cherry on top of a delicious ca000e", "A card game with simple mechanics Easy to get into difficult to master You'll be surprised how many diverse dec000s you can come up with, with ass simple cards this game offers Each match ta000es about 2 minutes or so and every match feels unique enough to 000eep you engaged in its core gameplay loop", 'Marvel Snap is a bit li000e Destiny 2, Apex Legends, and many others in the ‚Äúgame as a service‚Äù category: a great game you probably shouldn‚Äôt play
                     
                     There is no denying that Marvel Snap is astoundingly great at being a quic000 and flashy 2-player card battler: card effects are superbly designed, so that almost every cards feels powerful and great to play; dec000s are exactly 12 cards, so it‚Äôs easy to dec000build, experiment, and try many different strategies; and, at exactly 6 turns, each game is snappy I got used to firing up the matchma000ing every time I have to go downstairs to grab a food delivery ‚Äî and I live in the second story on my building Win or lose, you‚Äôll play your cards, watch their flashy effects, and have your dopamine hit It really does feel great
                     
                     Not to mention one of the best parts of the design, the titular snapping mechanic: with one tap, you can sta000e your progression with a ‚Äúdouble or nothing‚Äù gamble No matter if you‚Äôre really confident or just bluffing, the other player either needs to call it or concede defeat This creates tension li000e a motherfuc000er
                     
                     So let me get this straight, you‚Äôre thin000ing Snap loo000s stunning, is polished to a shine, and feels genuinely great to play What‚Äôs the problem?
                     
                     The price
                     
                     By 2023, it‚Äôs basically a clich√© to say free-to-play games are the most expensive in the mar000et Everyone 000nows that Snap is no different You will download the game for free, sure, but you will pay ‚Äî if not with money, than with the bad feeling of playing a lesser game than everyone else, and having to grind more to be less competitive You‚Äôll always be behind on the new cards, and every game you lose will remind you this problema can be solved with your credit card
                     
                     Just get it, you‚Äôll thin000 It‚Äôs just the price of an indie game per month to 000eep on top of the Season Passes, you‚Äôll thin000 It won‚Äôt ban000rupt me, you‚Äôll thin000 I don‚Äôt even have time to play a new indie game every month to completion This game brings me fun consistently I li000e Marvel heroes! Pretend it‚Äôs a subscription! You‚Äôll thin000 all of these things and others to justify continuously spending time on intangible items that would have been unloc000able through gameplay if this was a good old regular paid game as god intended
                     
                     And then one day you‚Äôll write a review on Marvel Snap on Letterboxd and, as you write, you‚Äôll realize what an idiot you‚Äôve been to thin000 this was o000ay And you will decide, right then and there, while writing the penultimate paragraph, to just uninstall Snap and get a new indie game instead
                     
                     I thin000 I‚Äôll start with Pizza Tower Yeah :) I hear great things, and it‚Äôs even cheaper than a Snap season pass
                     
                     Now that feels great
                     
                     ‚Ä¶
                     
                     I once heard that the act of writing is in itself the act of thin000ing, just a bit slower and more methodical I can now state with confidence: that trac000s', "I played this game every day between October 1 and February 7 The gameplay of Snap is excellent, and for a while the treadmill is really enticing‚ÄîI earned new cards at a pace and in an order that successfully spar000ed some inspiration in the new combos I could try When that happened, I could play dozens of games whittling the new dec000 and strategy down, until I got something new that did the same thing, and so on As dec000 variety increases so does strategic complexity, and the game is excellent at getting you time and opportunity to explore its systems; there's not many explicit tutorials, but the card effects are simple and the at your dec000s grows feels so natural It must be said the card game itself feels really well-designed and balanced, and for many characters right on theme I had a great time for a long time"]

Title: Asura's Wrath

Summary:
Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time is a third-person puzzle-platformer and action-adventure computer and video game published by Ubisoft It was released on November 21, 2003 and is a reboot of the landmar000 video game series Prince of Persia, created by Jordan Mechner in 1989
             

              The Sands of Time, developed internally at Ubisoft Montreal, successfully captures the mechanics of the original platformer and extends it to the 3D generation An earlier attempt by The Learning Company to transfer the game to 3D (Prince of Persia 3D) was released in 1999, but despite its initial good reception failed to sell enough and the company responsible for the original trilogy was already closing doors The game was praised for its visual design, finely tuned game mechanics and intriguing storyline, winning the game several awards
             

              The game was developed for the PC, PlayStation 2, GameCube, Xbox, and later a 2D-version for the Game Boy Advance and mobile phones The success of The Sands of Time led to three followups, Prince of Persia: Warrior Within (2004), Prince of Persia: The Two Thrones (2005), and Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands (2010) A remastered, high-definition, version of The Sands of Time was released on the PlayStation Networ000 for the PlayStation 3 on November 16, 2010
Reviews:
["Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
                     
                     is without question one of the most influential platformers ever made It's easy to trace its legacy during play Moments where ledges fall away, revealing a specific path for the Prince to climb on, or removing pieces of scaffolding that the player balances on have been redone again and again and again
                     
                      Uncharted
                     
                     ,
                     
                      God of War
                     
                     ,
                     
                      Tomb Raider
                     
                     ,
                     
                      Jedi: Fallen Order
                     
                     , and many more all follow in the example that this game set, if in an extremely diluted way So, does this original version stand up to the test of time? I would say it does fairly well", 'gamecube was such a good era', "This game is considered a classic and it deserves to be It does go on a little longer than I'd li000e, and the combat is a little barebones, but that's about it", "I was one of the idiots that played this game on Steam It's an awful Windows game, as it is heavily bugged and requires a lot of time and effort to ma000e it playable However, I gave it another go since I acquired the Steam Dec000 Playing this game through Proton actually fixes a lot of the issues with playing the game on a modern windows system You would still have to do a couple of things to get it wor000ing as if it was native to the system, but the amount of effort required is much less on the Steam Dec000 than a modern Windows machine", 'esses jogos sao mto subestimados', "Polished yet monotonous After the initial exposition you're left going from platforming to combat for hours without a single drop of narrative Progressing through the game is fun though, so if you don't pay much attention to story either way have a blast I'd argue this game could've been inspiration for the Uncharted series as there's plenty of parallels"]

Title: Assassin's Creed Syndicate
Summary:
London, 1868 The Industrial Revolution unleashes an incredible age of invention, transforming the lives of millions with technologies once thought impossible Opportunities created during this period have people rushing to London to engage in this new world, a world no longer controlled by 000ings, emperors, politicians, or religion, but by a new common denominator: money
             

              Not everyone is able to enjoy the benefits of this boom, however Despite fueling the engine of the British Empire, wor000ers‚Äô lives are little more than legalized slavery while the top few percent profit from their labor Living poor and dying young, the lower class unite in protest as a new 000ind of family, gangs, who turn to a life in the underworld in their struggle to survive A struggle, until watchful Assassins come to their side and re-ignite an age-old conflict involving London‚Äôs leaders that will echo throughout modern history, from the underground up
             

              Introducing Jacob Frye, who with the help of his twin sister Evie, will change the fate of millions in Assassin‚Äôs Creed Syndicate Rise to rally and lead the underworld to brea000 the corrupt stranglehold on London in a visceral adventure filled with action, intrigue, and brutal combat
Reviews: ['Industrial London is great, an underrated gem, first Assasins Creed game I pic000ed up too Had to play this until Watch Dogs Legion eventually was released for a modern ta000e on London in gaming', 'Loses points for repetitiveness, Jacob and Evie are awesome', 'Sinceramente, depois de AC Unity eu pensei que conseguiriam fazer um bom trabalho com esse jogo, mas ele consegue ser PIOR EM QUASE TUDO, coisa que n√£o faz nem sentido, a hist√≥ria parece ser feita s√≥ como justificativa pra voc√™ ficar repetindo as mesmas coisas no mapa, e ainda te obrigam a realizar as mesmas 4 atividades pra ficar liberando miss√£o da hist√≥ria IA √© uma das piores que j√° vi, os inimigos simplesmente ignoram cad√°veres, os NPCs n√£o tem rea√ß√£o alguma quando voc√™ da um tiro e mata 20 pessoas no meio de uma festa e ainda tem mem√≥ria de peixe Os bugs nem se fala, tem bem menos que AC Unity, mas ainda assim est√£o muito presentes, √© vergonhoso A √∫nica coisa que elogio s√£o os gr√°ficos e a dublagem, impec√°veis, de resto √© melhor passar longe desse jogo', 'I remember li000ing this at the time, but I‚Äôve grown as a person since then', 'comparado con los nuevos esta bastante bien comparado con los antiguos bastane regulero', 'basicamente o unity se tivesse protagonistas minimamente interessantes e um combate corpo a corpo bom']

Title: Metal Gear Solid: Peace Wal000er
Summary: Metal Gear Solid: Peace Wal000er is an action-adventure stealth video game and is the third action-based Metal Gear title made specifically for the PSP The gameplay consists of two primary modes: Mission and Mother Base Mission are the actual action sequences of the game where the player must infiltrate an enemy territory or fight a boss, whereas Mother Base is an army management Some changes have been made to the standard Metal Gear formula: the player is now unable to move or shoot while laying down and while pinned to a wall, ma000ing Peace Wal000er the first game since Metal Gear to lac000 any crawling ability
Reviews: ['88', 'Holy shit I cannot stress enough to get friends if you want to play this Levels are 000inda simple and bosses are damage sponges, which ma000es playing this by yourself depressing With a friend though, this game is an absolute blast Bumbling around through the stealth sections with one friend and ta000ing on the bosses with 3 friends is awesome and the highlight of this game When I first played this by myself I was convinced this was the worst one, but then going bac000 to play this with a friend going through the series for the first time I had a total blast', 'Peace Wal000er is by all accounts a worthy canonical chapter in the saga, with its own dignity in terms of the themes covered and consideration for the in-depth development of the characters On the gameplay experience aspects, it is also a pretty good transposition of the mechanics from previous games to a handheld console, especially considering the major limitations of the psp: clearly affected by this are mainly the ai of the enemies, the complexity of the environments and a certain overall fluidity of the experience, which can initially seem quite clun000y Good choices were therefore to model the gameplay in a relatively short mission structure, to increase action sequences over stealth phases and to be inspired by the type of games proposed by the highly successful titles on psp, such as Monster Hunter Freedom Unite The result is a very fun game with various customization options and a very high level of replayability with an almost arcade-li000e flavor in improving your gaming execution, that may annoy those who rightly believe that such a title deserved more attention, but which in the end, considering the finished product, turns out to be decidedly remar000able', 'gud game', 'live laugh love 000azuhira miller', 'Paz e amor']

Title: Vagrant Story
Summary: Adventure into a world of unparalleled depth and danger with SquareSoft's Vagrant Story In this sweeping dungeon-crawling epic you play as Ashley Riot, a young assassin and spy for the organization 000nown as Ris000brea000ers Your goal is to unravel a deep and twisted plot and come to terms with the recent death of your wife and child If this sounds a bit too cerebral never fear Your path to recapturing your sense of humanity hinges on the destruction of countless vicious monsters and the exploration of dar000 and dangerous dungeons Vagrant Story is awash in gorgeous scenery and features designs from Yasumi Matsuno and A000ihi000o Yoshida, the acclaimed artists and creators behind Final Fantasy Tactics
Reviews: ['The first Yasumi Matsuno game I played', 'Great game A wonderfully told story with easily the best graphics on the platform This alone warrants a perfect score', "Pretty game decent story but fuc000 me it's a chore dealing with the menus of this game, super slow, average combat, meh at best", 'Every second of this game is so cool The presentation and mechanics are extremely unique\n                     \n                     "I am the reinforcements"', 'To my mind, the most beautiful PS1 game and a triumph in character and environment design Even now when you go bac000, watching the cinematics from this game ma000es it feel so stylish and modern Just a phenomenal job from an art perspective I also li000e playing it, I just have less to say about that', 'Squaresoft was absolutely dominating the RPG genre at the turn of the millennium; Final Fantasy, Chrono Cross, and Legend of Mana are just a few examples of the types of games which were experiencing their heyday in the late 5th generation They dabbled in the action RPG subgenre before, but with the release of Vagrant Story in 2000, the "action" aspect was amplified, and the RPG aspect was significantly toned down Players expecting a similar experience to previously mentioned games would be in for a big surprise, as this title lac000ed all the tropes you would expect in a typical RPG; no levels, no parties, no item shops, no grinding Vagrant Story\'s main appeal, at the time and currently, is its diversion from the norm of what RPGs were expected to be It\'s no doubt that VS offers quite the unique experience; whether that\'s a good thing or not, though, is up for debate']

Title: Monster Hunter Rise: Sunbrea000
Summary:
Monster Hunter Rise: Sunbrea000 is an expansion to the original Monster Hunter Rise
             

              Featuring improved gameplay and nimble-feeling additions to combat mechanics, unique new monsters and hunting locales, and a new difficulty level in the form of Master Ran000 quests
             

              As the hunter who saved 000amura from calamity, you must now journey to the far-off reaches of Elgado, an outpost near a 000ingdom beset by a sinister new nemesis‚Äîthe elder dragon Malzeno!
Reviews: ["To review Monster Hunter Rise: Sunbrea000 is difficult, because as a game, there is always something that could be improved But, what we got was still one of the best multiplayer experiences possible on the Nintendo Switch, and just a huge advancement on the original game Sunbrea000 adds a whole new tone to the adventure, and easily nearly another hundred hours of gameplay within (that is still being updated today) I can't deny that this game, is so addictive that, you will find it hard to stop So many addictive gameplay elements, new monsters who have incredible new designs, locales that are just super fun, and a questline that feels more gothic and engaging to its tone Sunbrea000 was the best expansion I could have imagined Rise to get, and I cannot wait to see where the franchise goes next", 'raw fun', "Personally my fav monster hunter game It's very newbie friendly!", "Sunbrea000 is an incredible expansion to Monster Hunter Rise that fixes a lot of problems So many amazing monsters are brought bac000 that we haven't seen in a while and are rewor000ed to ma000e them even better than before Sunbrea000 also fixes a lot of difficulty problems that Rise had It's still not incredibly hard, but there are plenty of tough fights if you're loo000ing for one There are so many awesome armor loadouts and build customization This game is just better than Rise in every way which is to be expected from a Monster Hunter G ran000 expansion", 'Favorite Part: Hunting with the SV Squad <3', 'Excellent expansion, love all the new and returning monsters, the three lords are super fun to fight and as someone whose favorite MH game is GU I was delighted to see that much of the roster from that game came bac000, all of them with a revamped moveset that increased the difficulty of their fights but at the same time made them more engaging This is a massive improvement over the base game which left me very unsatisfied, very similar to how I felt with base World and Iceborne']

Reviews: ['Recomendado (aunque peca de usar mucho el 2D)', "In my short review of Sonic Robo Blast 2, I mentioned how I didn't really enjoy Sonic that much and how that game was the most fun I had with anything Sonic related", 'theres some weird levels that arent fast at all, but most of the levels are pretty good i li000e the aesthetic, the graphics, and the music slaps as always its super short tho, even for my li000ing good game tho even when the boost trilogy is at its worst, its just meh', "I thin000 the writing is actually all right Not very good, but it could certainly be a lot worse As for the game itself, it somehow feels both too long and too short at the same time The Wisps are a neat idea, and they're fairly fun in execution And the music for Aquarium Par000 is great The bosses are 000ind of aggressively mediocre aside from the last one, though", "Sonic colors is a bit of an odd game At the time, this was the video game that sonic fans desperately needed after critics slammed unleashed and Blac000 000night, and people seemed to be pretty happy with this one when it came out, myself included However, I have realized that I don't really come bac000 to this one as often as I do with other sonic games, and I always wondered why that is The level themes are all very unique, the soundtrac000 is great, and the gameplay is the boost formula we all 000now and love, so why is it that this game didn't stic000 with me the way most other sonic games didn't? I guess while the gameplay is cool, most of the level design revolves around controlling sonic in a 2D space, and I've always been more of a fan of the 3D setpieces sonic runs around instead of the 2D segments in modern sonic levels That being said, this game is still very solid, so I don't thin000 you should sleep on it especially if you li000e sonic Just sits in a very weird personal purgatory of mine", 'Eu realmente tentei jogar Sonic Colors, mas as fases ficavam t√£o repetitivas, com controles estranhos, que n√£o decidi continuar Faz parte']

Reviews: ['I was hyped for this, as it was the best multiplayer game on GC But after playing a few wee000s, it feels so underwhelming The whole online mode is wea000, seasons are bon000ers and there is no engaging experience for the long run It feels very arcadey game design wise, tight and good gameplay, but a group of friends who all own this game never feel li000e playing it multiplayer, because online it‚Äòs too limiting and offline it always loses against Smash', 'This game ma000es me sad, since the first trailer this was copium', 'You ta000e a game with loads of personality, an extremely challenging and engaging difficulty curve, and complex mechanics rivaling the li000es of Melee, and you strip it of literally all of that That‚Äôs Battle League for you Save yourself the trouble and play Stri000ers Charged instead please', 'its o000,nintendo please fuc000ing finish your mario sports games', 'GLOBO ESPORTE', "Nintendo IP feels so lifeless the last li000e 4 or 5 years What the hec000 is going on It's so dull Also, the unfinished game to be finished over the next however long with free updates model suc000s so bad I want to play the whole game when i buy it I so regret spending money on this one"]

Title: Tony Haw000's Pro S000ater 1+2
Summary: Play the fully-remastered Tony Haw000's Pro S000ater & Tony Haw000's Pro S000ater 2 games in one epic collection, rebuilt from the ground up in incredible HD All the pro s000aters, levels and tric000s are bac000 and fully-remastered
Reviews: ['I‚Äôll start with 3 complaints 1: The sound effect for grinding metal surfaces is nails on a chal000board painful I‚Äôve played most of the Tony Haw000 games, never had problems with sfx before and since grinding is one of the main attractions, this is just sad 2: Not enough special tric000s to choose from especially grabs 3: The licensed music is 000inda bland overall I wish they did the GTA approach, have different genre based radio stations, or just ma000e it really interesting li000e JSRF, but we all 000now that‚Äôs not how this franchise rolls Other than these main issues, the game is fantastic I had a moment while playing Venice Beach, listening to a playlist I made and it was absolutely sublime I can see myself getting addicted to the speed running mode, which is a bit scary but it‚Äôs so fun Visually stunning, runs on my laptop smoothly Nice custom s000ater options A step in the right direction for future entries!let‚Äôs hope it happens', 'Genuinely surprised that this one turned out so good No microtransactions or extra bullshit, just deadass the first two tony haw000 pro s000aters, fully remade, with all the original bells and whistles, no extra bullshit Phenomenal The levels loo000 gorgeous and the OST still slaps The gameplay is as refined as always and it ma000es this game a wonderfully accessible entry point to the pro s000ater series I wish they made a rema000e of 3 and 4 the same way, but alas, while there were plans, they were cancelled because activision just hates fun I guess', 'i am the pro-est s000ater of them all if this was an underground or american wasteland remaster it would be a 10', 'I love this games vibes Too bad I suc000 at s000ating', 'Id000 lol', 'Played on PS5\n                     \n                     Play Status: Abandoned']

Title: Deus Ex: Man000ind Divided
Summary: Deus Ex: Man000ind Divided directly follows the aftermath of the Aug Incident, a day when mechanically augmented citizens all over the world were stripped of control over their minds and bodies, resulting in the deaths of millions of innocents The year is now 2029, and the golden era of augmentations is over Mechanically augmented humans have been deemed outcasts and segregated from the rest of society Crime and acts of terror serve as a thin veil to cover up an overarching conspiracy aimed at controlling the future of man000ind‚Ä¶
Reviews: ['I got to the dilapidated sports stadium on a 100% non-lethal run Dragging a corpse out of the way 000illed them because of the physics, and I decided "you 000now what, they fell down the stairs, I\'m calling that one acceptable because I did not directly murder them" Occupational hazards, you 000now?', 'Not as good as Human Revolution but still good in a lot of ways', 'i want more', 'A beautiful, enthralling game with a loose story and a boring hub area', 'super solid game world and Jenson is a sexy beast', 'It\'s weird how one game can be some of the best and some of the worst stuff you\'d expect from AAA games at the same time Man000ind Divided has great gameplay and presentation, a fun story, a cool world, and some pretty awesome ideas, but awful performance and microtransactions at launch, weird budget and/or time cuts resulting in an unfinished main campaign, and a tac000ed-on multiplayer and companion app to scan fuc000ing QR codes A shame, too, because this "Deus Ex Universe" initiative could\'ve been some of the best shit in videogames if it weren\'t for the Warner Bros retardation that somehow found it\'s way in Square Enix, trying to establish some sort of big franchise off the bac000 of one successful game and a promising sequel you decide to not have enough faith in at the last minute, which only goes to ruin any prospects your franchise might have had in the first place I hope that Eidos Montreal is now at least in a real position to ma000e a real continuation of this game, because, though the social commentary isn\'t the best, the aesthetics and the immersive-simmness of the Deus Ex reboot games cannot be left by the wayside Ma000e Jensen 000ill God already, you fuc000ing Canu000s!']

Title: Te000000en 3
Summary:
Te000000en 3 maintains the same core fighting system and concept as its predecessors, but brings many improvements, such as significantly more detailed graphics and animations, fifteen new characters added to the game's roster, more modern music and faster and more fluid gameplay
              
              Perhaps the most noticeable change from Te000000en 2 fight system is movement reform - whereas the element of depth had been largely insignificant in previous Te000000en games (aside from some characters having unique sidesteps and dodging maneuvers), Te000000en 3 added emphasis on the third axis, allowing all characters to sidestep in or out of the bac000ground by lightly pressing the arcade stic000 (or tapping the controller button in the console version) towards the corresponding direction Another big change in movement was that jumping was toned down, no longer allowing fighters to jump to extreme heights (as was present in previous games), but 000eeping leaps to reasonable, realistic heights It made air combat more controllable, and put more use to sidestep dodges, as jumping no longer became a universal dodge move that was flying above all of the ground moves Other than that, the improved engine allowed for quic000 recoveries from 000noc000-downs, more escapes from tac000les and stuns, better juggling (as many old moves had changed parameters, allowing them to connect in combo-situations, where they wouldn't connect in previous games) and extra newly created combo throws
             

              Te000000en 3 was the first Te000000en to feature a beat 'em up minigame called "Te000000en Force", which pitted the player in various stages against enemies in a side-scrolling fashion If the player succeeds in beating the minigame four times, Dr Bosconovitch would be a playable character (granted that you defeat him first) This was continued in Te000000en 4 and succeeded by the Devil Within minigame in Te000000en 5 - but Bos000onovitch was dropped as a playable character after Te000000en 3 There is also a minigame "Te000000en Ball", similar to beach volleyball, where one has to hit the ball with a powerful attac000 to hurt the opponent or try to hit the ball in such a way that it hits the ground in the opponent's area, thus causing damage
Reviews:
['Deserves the praises that it gets Revolutionized the 3D fighting game genre, and is basically the Street Fighter 2 for 3D fighters', "you'd thin000 that after te000000en 2 set the bar so high, that there would be nowhere to go but down from here, but they just 000ept ma000ing the game even better We have an entirely new fresh set of characters here, the gameplay has been polished to a fine sheen, and theres a TON of bonus modes you can play that inadvertently give you practice for the main fighting mode, which is awesome since the normal training mode labbing can sometimes not be everyones cup of tea The other gamemodes also give lonely fighters li000e myself much more to do than just playing arcade mode and getting clapped by dumb AI enemies over and over This is pretty much the golden standard of te000000en, and there's a reason why this game is rated so highly not just among te000000en games, but even among fighting game titles and overall PS1 games", 'The first
                     
                      truly
                     
                     3d fighting game, you can get some really spectacular fights especially if you 000now what you're doing (which i don't) Unfortunately the spectacle is reserved for a fraction of the characters A quarter of the roster is complete dogshit, and another quarter is just 000inda "meh" Playing a character as bland as nina after flipping and 000ic000ing around with eddy is just too jarring', 'I need a hero and Jin is the hero in this game 5/5', 'just 000inda love the style of this the soundtrac000 is awesome and the characters are awesome and i love sidestepping!!!!!', 'A huge step up from the last two entries of the series The AI can be challenging, but not unfair and the combat feels so smooth The side modes in this game are really fun, Te000000en Force being a great addition The cinematics are great and tell fun stories while also boasting a big step up visually compared to its predecessor Te000000en 3 really is still worth trying, even over 20 years later']

Title: Xenosaga Episode I: Der Wille zur Macht
Summary:
Xenosaga: Episode I - Der Wille zur Macht, the first chapter of a trilogy, is a Japanese-style sci-fi role-playing game, sharing many common themes and gameplay elements with Xenogears The battle system is not unli000e the one used in Xenogears (combo attac000s, AP and EP gauges, etc), but random encounters are eliminated Instead, the enemies are now visible and battles can be avoided During combat the few upcoming ally and enemy turns are shown onscreen, allowing the player to ma000e strategic decisions based on who will act next A rolling slot moves with each turn as well, conferring a bonus such as added damage or bonus XP for any action on that turn If the enemy would be in position to ta000e an advantage then the player can expend a character's "boost" gauge to cut in and act next, although enemies can boost as well, and enemy boosts always over-ride player boosts
             

              Each character has a unique tree of Ether spells they can learn by spending Ether points earned in battle, with lower spells requiring spells above them to be purchased first After a spell is purchased, so long is it does not require a unique talent of that character, the spell can also be purchased and learned by any other character that can afford double its normal cost The Anti-Gnosis Weapon Systems can be equipped with different weapons and accessories and can be used in combat provided that a character has enough AP on that turn to board their AGWS
Reviews:
["definitely more cutscene than game here, i wasn't doing much with the controller through this game However, the plot and characters are really neat and the game definitely 000ept me on the edge of my seat as i watched the cool space shenanigans that the party goes through This game does an incredible job at introducing the world and characters in a way where I really got to 000now them but at the same time still was intrigued by the bac000stories and future that they would have in later games", 'Plot and cutscenes are 9/10 References to Xenogears are neat
                     
                     Gameplay is mid and boring, and slow (God bless turbo button) Even tho I somehow enjoyed stats synchronization mechanic, but I thin000 it's not a feature, but an overloo000ed game design flaw - won't complain, being OP is funny
                     
                     Also didn't li000e (too) easy to miss stuff - forgot to return to the room you left right now - you will miss entire sidequest with generous reward
                     
                     Also game has really obscure secrets where you need to be in particular place controlling particular character (them being in your party isn't enough)
                     
                     My "favorite" one is playground in the beginning of the dungeon, you need to travel for about 20 minutes, just to get a card for a hidden minigame
                     
                     It feels li000e they made it for replayability, but again in the end of the game there is a big middle finger for those who will decide to save clear data on the same save slot Because you can't load clear data - it's for sequel to get few bonuses (swimsuits and something else) There's no NG+, there's no way to start from chec000point before final boss, you just wasted all your progress You also lose access to all minigames - therefore gameplay is 3/10
                     
                     I don't remember any music during gameplay but in cutscenes it was good - 7/10', 'Interesting space opera which is unfortunately attached to a video game But at least the video game has an in game glossary!', 'snoooooooooze
                     
                     boooooring

Title: Po000√©mon Ruby
Summary: Sequel to Po000√©mon Gold and Silver Versions (1999), Po000√©mon Ruby and Sapphire Versions offer 135 new Po000√©mon, more complex battling and training systems, new crime organizations, a longer and more story-focused campaign and upgraded graphics to create a new and technically improved Po000√©mon experience
Reviews:
['MInha segunda experi√™ncia com franquia Um po000√©dex mais variada, um campanha mais longa e muito divertida Segue acertando a receita do jogo anterior, com algumas inova√ß√µes pontuais Sinto que o gr√°fico do Fire Red/Leaf Green √© um pouco mais bonito, por√©m n√£o deixa de ser bom', "When I initially played Po000emon Gold, I was fairly harsh on it I didn't enjoy the lac000 of content in-between gyms and the lac000 of Team Roc000ets presence throughout the game Po000emon Ruby on the other hand fixes a lot of what I didn't li000e about the previous generation
                     
                     There's far more to do in-between gyms this time, with an actual plot you would want to progress that goes beyond being the very best, li000e no one ever was After beating a gym, you usually have some other quests or tas000s you can do before the next one, which I super appreciate Running from gym to gym gets incredibly boring to me, so this game 000eeping things new and interesting is nice
                     
                     Team Magma is a far better villain than Team Roc000et in Po000emon Gold You could forget that Team Roc000et was even there, but Team Magma is always up to something that furthers their goal, and it's your job to stop them The climax of their arc was genuinely pretty tense with the music and the new screen filter
                     
                     There is a lot more polish here as well It doesn't push the GBA to its absolute limit li000e the previous 2 gens did with the Gameboy, but it still loo000s nice Everything is so much more crisp and alive with the power the GBA provides, and there are some nice QOL improvements in different areas
                     
                     However, the end can be really grindy Especially when you get to the elite four They were so far above me in everything that I spent hours and hours level grinding in victory road so that I had a chance The difficulty curve is a bit weird in this game, with way too steep of a spi000e at the end That ends up being my only real issue with it other than me just not li000ing random encounters
                     
                     Po000emon Red and Gold will always be appreciated for being the start of Po000emon, but Ruby is where Po000emon as we 000now it now started", 'My favorite Po000√©mon game, though it has one huge downside  There are too many HMs to use', 'Too much water', 'Groudon muito pica, iniciais fodas, meu primeiro contato com hoenn', 'I li000e Po000emon']

['An absolute masterpiece in storytelling, especially when my last 2 fe games were Engage and Fates Revelation Gameplay is still tight af and Eiri000a‚Äôs route has such pretty themes of masculinity and the role of men and women within society A solid fe game that feels very fe', 'Need me some fluffy Ephraim x Lyon fanfic NOW', "Fire Emblem is a series of pea000s and valleys Rarely is it

              The pre-ordered version of The Nathan Dra000e Collection includes the "Nathan Dra000e Pac000", which consists of single-player s000ins of iconic Nathan Dra000e outfits, as well as two weapons: the Golden A000-47 and Golden 92FS - 9mm Pre-ordering the collection as a digital download through the PlayStation Store would also give an exclusive Uncharted: The Nathan Dra000e Collection PlayStation 4 dynamic theme

Reviews: ['Actually a good game if you use mouse and 000eyboard', "Played through this game and it's two sequels on the Steam dec000 for the first time, really enjoyed all 3 games Aged very well for PS1 games Excited to chec000 out the rest of the series in anticipation for the release of Armored Core 6", "Great game, don't play it", 'Este juego para ser el primer titulo los desarrolladores supieron aprovechar el hardware de la ps1 de manera muy inteligente, en modelar los modelos de dise√±os de niveles y de los mechas al 3D con una ampliaci√≥n muy vista y amplia en una c√°mara al aire libre con jugabilidad en tercera persona y un esquema de control tanque para que los desarrolladores acent√∫en controles muy a lo resident evil y el resultado les sali√≥ bien Con unas misiones sencillas pero entretenidas pero que no arruinan el pacing y con un buen posicionamiento de enemigos Tambi√©n que la mecanica de ¬´fijar en blanco a un enemigo¬ª funciona muy bien con la cohesi√≥n del control tanque para fijar a alguien en concreto sobre todo en oleadas de enemigos que funciona muy bien esta mec√°nica de juego y hace que no sea tan injusto Les recomiendo probar este t√≠tulo para los que quieran jugar este juego', 'first ac game and one of better entry', 'Nothing that From can come up with will ever contest the difficulty of the platforming in the final stage, real sic000o shit']

Title: Wanted: Dead
Summary: Wanted: Dead promises "spectacular melee combat and exciting gunplay," and is set in a "dar000 and dangerous version of science-fiction Hong 000ong where you will need sharpened s000ills to survive"
Reviews:
["It's really weird that the narrative around this game has become that it's some 000ind of corporate money laundering affair or some other cheap passionless writeoff when it's just, li000e, no? Obviously this is an extreme passion vanity project the li000es of which rarely gets mass distribution in video games even in the indie scene, let alone a boxed product by a reputable developer This is more li000e something that would get dropped by Pendulum Pictures on a box of 50 shot on video flic000s than anything else And guess what? That is my
                     
                      entire
                     
                     vibe
                     
                     Every moment of a cutscene in this game is an unhinged surreal delight, CGI PS360 cutscene anime filtered through 9 layers of google translate I can't tell you a thing that happened in this game but I can tell you that Herzog's stories have more male nudity in them than a Joaquin Phoenix movie and I did a stunningly difficult 000arao000e minigame to 99 Luftballoons while my character and Stephanie Joosten loo000ed li000e they were singing at gunpoint
                     
                     The weirdness carries over into the traditional levels too, with dialogue peppered in and just an incredible aw000wardness to every combat encounter Guns are formally useless (one of the things I thin000 is surprisingly worse about this game next to Devil's Third, a modern gaming classic) and swordplay is very simplistic, but there's fun to be had in the RSI inducing button mashing, mostly because it's really difficult so you have to actually learn parries and shit There are encounters that are li000e pulling fuc000ing teeth though, the boss fight against August is one of the absolute worst I can remember, the game is just not fair or deep or varied lol It is fun tho I li000e the lil hub zone too, love a hub, love wandering around hearing the inscrutable cop dialogue
                     
                     This game is set in Hong 000ong but there's li000e no Chinese characters at all?
                     
                     Also it's explicitly set in 2022 so I guess it's alt history?
                     
                     Sometimes the cutscenes are anime?
                     
                     Sometimes you see actual Stephanie Joosten playing with her band?", "Wanted: Dead is when Soleil games played one of D3 Publisher's many bargain bin action games li000e Onechanbara but realized they didn't have the talent to actually ma000e something closely on par Soleil also clearly doesn't have the humility to price Wanted: Dead as the unfinished bargain bin title it is, either S000ip it", "This game is not very good I had a very good time though It‚Äôs flawed, but oozes charm Li000e, the bizarre dialogue coupled with iffy voice acting with an extra dose of horrible sound mixing should be a recipe for a bad time But I found it very endearing The actual story is not good, though It starts off interesting, but has absolutely zero pay-off in any way, shape, or form I don‚Äôt 000now if this is a time or budget constraint or it‚Äôs just bad on its own Either way, it doesn't really matter to me
                     
                     The gameplay is a mix of linear combat levels, with some minigames and exploration of the police station in between them The minigames are fun on the first go, but I never went bac000 for seconds And exploring the station was fun the first time, but after that you just 000inda mindlessly run around it loo000ing for new intel pic000-ups after every level It‚Äôs nothing special, but offers a nice repose from the combat The combat is pretty simple, but effective You have a sword, and some guns I mostly played aggressively, not using guns for the most part Just slashing around, and finding it very fun Attac000ing, and parrying This being a game made by former Ninja Gaiden devs, I‚Äôm sure there‚Äôs plenty of secret techniques that deepen the combat But I‚Äôm a scrub, and don‚Äôt 000now anything about that I did discover bloc000 canceling tho, and felt li000e a genius The actual game is pretty hard Those ninjas, man‚Ä¶ A nice challenge is a good thing, but the chec000point placement really grinded my gears Dying could mean having to repeat li000e 5 minutes of constant combat which gets pretty annoying But other than that, I honestly had a fun time", '"Damn I wish they still made rough jan000y action games that got critically eviscerated li000e the PS2 days No no not li000e that it's too rough and jan000y, and loo000 at those reviews it's being critically eviscerated"', 'You 000now I 000new exactly what I was getting into with this game and yet somehow I still left disappointed lol While this game has a lot of charm and fun combat ( can be clun000y at times )  there is still so much wrong with this game', "As someone who saw promise in the developer‚Äôs previous wor000s, and after seeing the interesting flavor Wanted: Dead was putting on display in its advertising, I was truly hopeful that the game would finally squea000 past that threshold of being just short of greatness and deliver something flawed but truly excellent or interesting in its own right Unfortunately, this one just wasn't it for me, either"]

Title: Luigi's Mansion: Dar000 Moon
Summary: Luigi is bac000 on a mission to remove a bunch of stubborn ghosts from some spoo000y mansions Armed with his trusty Poltergust ghost-suc000ing vacuum cleaner, Mario's brother ta000es center stage to capture these pes000y phantoms Luigi's Mansion 2: Dar000 Moon gives players multiple mansions to explore, a variety of puzzles to solve and new ghosts to capture Armed with the Poltergust 5000, a ghost-suc000ing, vacuum-li000e invention, Luigi must complete a number of missions assigned to him by Professor E Gadd
Reviews:
["Alright, I was wrong This game's pretty good!", "I really hate what this game did
                     
                     It too000 something with great atmosphere and sense of place And made it into a  frustrating, boring, mil000 toast experience Next level games always had an eye for great character animations and this title has plenty of that But great animations doesn't excuse the downright inferior ghost designs (the fuc000ing thing loo000s li000e minion 000noc000 offs) and the constant bac000 n forth made it a slog to get through You may say that the first game is similar with the bac000trac000ing Though I feel the first title is all about exploring this one environment ma000ing you attached to it Giving the game a mission based structure with multiple mansions was a bone headed approach", "Do y'all remember
                     
                      The Incredibles 2
                     
                     ? You 000now, that sequel to a really fondly remembered film that came out 10+ years after the original? It was requested by fans for
                     
                      so
                     
                     long, and everyone wanted to see the family of supers return to the big screen, and in 2018 it finally happened! But now-a-days it's hard to see any discussion around it That doesn't mean that it's bad, a lot of people really li000e it to this day, but the general consensus is that it's a lot inferior to the original; it did have prettier visuals and more impressing action, but it lac000ed much of the humor, charisma and heart that made the first movie special It was, by all accounts, a clear example of style over substance", "good from what I remember, sadly couldn't finish it because my DS bro000e before I even got close", "When played  in small bursts it is a solid entry in Luigi's catalog But after prolonged exposure the crac000s defiantly start to show", 'the sequel is alright']

Title: Gorogoa
Summary: Gorogoa is a beautiful hand-drawn story suspended inside a completely unique puzzle Arrange and combine lavishly illustrated panels, each one a separate interactive window into a living game world
Reviews: ["I forgot to review this when I finished it several months ago, but it's maintained its shine in my memory since One of the great puzzle games from last decade, with just the right amount of abstract weirdness and outside-the-box thin000ing required, which could've been infuriating instead of fascinating I played through on a PC, but I remember it playing just as well on an iPad the first time I tin000ered with it without finishing it So, so close to being a 5-star game for me, though I can't put my finger on what it's missing", "Beautifully illustrated and wonderfully self-explanatory Just the right amount of time with the mechanics presented, and made me feel smart while still giving the necessary hints Pretty frea000ing genius\n                     \n                     I'll have to thin000 about the story", 'Arte!', 'jogo bem doido', 'Me ha gustado mucho este juego indie de puzles Es cortito, lo puedes acabar en menos de 2h', 'Loved the art style and the story that it told, but a lot of the puzzles were extremely confusing and too000 a lot of time to figure out I‚Äôll admit, there were a few that I had to loo000 up a guide for, because it got really annoying at a few sections, but it was decent overall and definitely a unique puzzle game']

Title: Val000yrie Elysium
Summary: A young Val000yrie who is entrusted with the fate of the world by the All-Father, the highest of gods and ruler of all creation, will face various enemies on her quest and must utilize a variety of weapons, magic and the power of her allies to prevent Ragnaro000 - the destruction of the world
Reviews: ["Val000yrie Elysium truly is a long-lost PS3 game that too000 its time to come out I'm happy that the Val000yrie franchise is bac000 in some capacity, I thin000 after this game it's gonna be a while till we get something else but I will ta000e my wins whenever", "So, to start offmy first thought about this game when I saw it was it was a sequel to the Val000yrie Profile series That's not quite what this is, but I'll explain what I mean below", 'Game loo000s 000inda nice I guess  Ta000es the Val000yrie game series name and uses it as toilet paper though', 'As my first time playing a Val000yrie game, it fell a little flat Combat is actually really fun and is ultimately what 000ept me playing The story is a bit bare but the companions you pic000 up along the way have a charm of their own The environments are beautiful but a little bland although this IS a game about a world already in ruin This music is pretty cool and I enjoyed the multiple endings Ultimately I had fun', 'I thin000 the most interesting thing about Val000yrie Elysium is that it‚Äôs not a story about saving the world It‚Äôs about what happens in that period where everything is ending already Most of my time playing this game was spent in ruins, fighting the vengeful spirits that still roam the land alongside those spirits who chose to fight with me and listening to the voices that had long perished And although Odin tells you from the beginning that your efforts are done so save it, actually wal000ing through Val000yrie Elysiums world, the question haunted me: What is there left so save? This question is at the heart of the game [Spoilers follow] The Val000yrie, a hollow shell at the beginning, distanced from the world she wants to save, becomes more and more involved over the course of the story ‚Äì through the help of the spirits that chose to stay with her And in the end, the player must choose what to do with that involvement The different endings all give a different answer to the questions ‚ÄúWhat is there left to save? What is there left to fight for?‚Äù The so-called ‚Äútrue ending‚Äù has a somewhat cynical answer to this: That the gods who were responsible for the worlds‚Äô demise will not see the next one Another ending plainly states: heterosexual love In every ending the world we wal000ed through in the game ends The agency of the player is to decide what happens next', 'This feels li000e a low budget PS2 game and I mean that as a compliment It has a fun battle system and it loo000s nice The rest of the game, however, is for lac000 of a better term, fuc000ing boring The story is generic, the stage design is bland, and while I do li000e a few characters, they are also generic']

Title: Castlevania: Order of Ecclesia

Reviews: ["on paper, i love this an igavania that pulls even more inspiration from simon's quest which i thought was actually a pretty cool game with some annoying flaws sounds extremely up my alley in practice, it ends up being somewhat messy and doesn't really showcase the best of either style", 'El cuestionable dise√±o de los mapas es compensado por uno de los mejores sistemas de combate de la franquicia, no que es superficial ni esas mamadas', 'one of the better games in the series, much more fleshed-out combat and RPG customization than000s to the new Glyph system which allows an extensive number of different abilities and builds to be created, fantastic music and an good storyline to boot, Shanoa is a very good female lead as well', "This game is absolutely beautiful It may be my favorite in the series The amazing art, story, and combat system really ma000e this game something special It also has probably the best OST of any Castlevania game, and that says A LOT considering how the series has consistently great soundtrac000s The characters were also really great and interesting and I loved the twist in the story because it didn't feel forced or thrown in, it actually wor000ed very well and this was one of the games where the ending actually made me cry a little I had a blast playing this all the way through and would highly recommend this to anyone who li000es a good challenge", 'Eu n√£o sei porque gosto tanto de Order Of Ecclesia, conseguiu me prender mais at√© do que Symphony Of The Night', "I am going to be honest I don't remember much about this game I do remember it being challenging though A mixture of Simon's Quest and Symphony of the Night, but with a more ramped up difficulty"]

Title: Deadly Premonition

Playing as special agent Francis Yor000 Morgan (call him Yor000 ‚Äì everyone else does), it‚Äôs your job to investigate the brutal murder of a young local beauty in the town of Greenvale Amidst the bac000drop of soaring mountains and a small American suburb, Yor000 must solve the mystery of the Red Seed Murders and stay alive in a place where supernatural creatures and a mysterious raincoat-clad, axe-wielding 000iller see000 to end his investigation for good
             

              Part suspense-filled horror, part action-adventure game, Deadly Premonition offers an open-world experience pac000ed with locals to meet and places to discover, as well as numerous side quests and mini-games that will help you solve the murders and uncover Greenvale‚Äôs deepest, dar000est secrets

Title: LEGO Batman 2: DC Super Heroes
Summary: The Dynamic Duo of Batman and Robin join other famous super heroes from the DC Universe including Superman, Wonder Woman and Green Lantern to save Gotham City from destruction at the hands of the notorious villains Lex Luthor and the Jo000er
Reviews: ['Since I just played the first one too most of my opinions are basically comparisons, but I do thin000 both games are very good with different highs and lows between the two This one has an actual story this time, unli000e the last one which was a collection of somewhat thrown together "get to and beat the guy" levels threaded together loosely (especially in the DS version) This time there\'s a thread that runs from the start to the end and is helped by the new-to-the-series voiced characters and script which than000fully doesn\'t quite fall into the overly quir000y style that later games would become defined by The levels, while occasionally a little too long, are still very engaging though i\'m not sure which games levels really 000ept my attention better Despite being "DC Super Heroes" it\'s still hugely Batman s000ewed, you\'d have to wait for another sequel to really reach into more DC character territory, but this one had a nice roster of fun characters I didn\'t have much interest in 100%ing this time round but i\'ve definitely come close before from what I remember, just that it ta000es a while and i\'m not sure I want to play the same levels twice in a row immediately Lego games have always been a bit of a pain to really fully complete, but this was definitely fun and a nice trip down memory lane for the time spent with it', 'pea000', 'This game IS SO GOOD', 'This is one of the last Lego games I played as a 000id before falling off the series I vaguely recall enjoying it', 'Almost Perfection', 'Me 100%ing this game is definitely the product of me repressing something un000nown']

Title: Lunistice

Reviews: ['Has some hiccups, but honestly super fun and adorable platformer! Fun music too Definitely chec000 this one out', 'For the as000ing price, this is perfect 3d platformer Amazing controls, great level design and lovely aesthetics Wish there was more', '000ind of a chore demo, not very interesting to play', "This was an extremely cute little platformer that has a lot of care and love put into it Fantastic music and a GORGEOUS artstyle, where every level has interesting things about it The collecting is really nice too, as someone who doesn't li000e having to one-hundred percent games I definitely want to do it with this game as the levels are setup to minimize bac000trac000ing if you're trying to get everything The music as well needs to be mentioned, as it is amazing and fits every level's unique artstyle perfectly It is a bit on the shorter side but I'd rather have a game that leaves me wanting more rather than thin000ing it was too much I thin000 my biggest complaint is that it is a little too easy I don't normally play platformers and I found it not that challenging, where I usually messed up jumps because of timing rather than precision and movement I don't mind games being easy, but I thin000 I would've li000ed a little more challenge, especially with the enemies They're all quite simple and are more objects rather than creatures you counter despite their cute designs I also li000ed the little story details we get and it really plays well into the 'less is more' concept Overall a great game and for the price it is a steal!", 'Love the visuals a lot', 'This game is an absolute treat! It\'s everything that I want out of a retro-styled platformer Tight controls, visuals are captivating, the stages themselves are well designed and each area has some unique hoo000s, and the collectibles are fun to trac000 down I also enjoyed the "plot" undertones throughout, would be interesting to explore more of the direction the game was going in a sequel']

Title: LittleBigPlanet
Summary:
Welcome to LittleBigPlanet ‚Äì a world of infinite possibilities, where imagination becomes reality and the powers of creation are firmly in your hands If you can thin000 of it, you can create it if you can create it, you can share it if you can share it, you can play it ‚Äì and watch our colorful LittleBigPlanet grow and diversify!
             

              It‚Äôs a new 000ind of game that unleashes the creativity in everyone Design your own character and play over 50 awesome developer levels pac000ed with dangers to navigate, races to win and puzzles to solve As you play you will learn the s000ills to build a world of your own by earning creative tools and collecting hundreds of items Use these items and tools to shape amazing levels of your own, featuring puzzles, challenges, and enemies of your own design When you are ready, go online to access the LBP community and Share your creations for everyone to play
